posts.title: My American brothers, I am so fucking done.
posts.content:
I am a British man in my 40s. If you met me you'd probably like me. I am nice, friendly, gregarious. I love music, movies, BBQ, bourbon, cigarettes and guns. I have always hated leftism and identity politics. I judge people by what's inside them, not what they look like. I just wanted to be left alone.

I love my country. The country I have so many happy memories of. I grew up the youngest son of an Air Force officer, living in Buckinghamshire in the 80s, right by the Chalfont hills. A truly beautiful part of the world. You country boys on here would recognise it instantly and be at home there. Kind of town where everyone knew each other and was so high trust. Kids could play in the woods all day and come home at dusk. The only questions our parents would ask is "Where are the boys? Do they have the dog with them? OK that's fine". There was no danger. It was Arcadia.

That world seems gone to me know. I do not recognise my country any more. Our cities are stinking ghettoes, filled with muslim savages. Our government and police ignore any crimes against us, the rightful stewards of this once great land, but rush to protect the interests of the hateful invading horde that squats in our beautiful county.

We welcomed them here. We offered them peace, freedom, and the chance to make whatever they wanted of themselves. They repaid us by raping and murdering our children, blowing us up in suicide attacks, and spewing constant hatred and threats of violence against us.

I never thought it would come to this but I pray for civil war. That is our only hope. I will stay and fight. I am actually relishing the prospect of killing these filthy, ungrateful subhumans. Should I feel shame for that? My innate Englishness tells me I should. But I do not. Any capacity for guilt and shame has been burned away by a white hot fire of hatred I would never have believed I was capable of. A hatred I am scared will consume me.

I am not even sure why I am typing this out. Maybe I just needed to get it off my chest. If you read it, thank you and all I ask is you keep us in your hearts and in your prayers.

Maybe one day, stranger reading this, we will raise a glass together to celebrate the final victory over the evil in the world.

I truly hope so.

posts.title: My American brothers, I am so fucking done.
posts.content:
I am a British man in my 40s. If you met me you'd probably like me. I am nice, friendly, gregarious. I love music, movies, BBQ, bourbon, cigarettes and guns. I have always hated leftism and identity politics. I judge people by what's inside them, not what they look like. I just wanted to be left alone.

I love my country. The country I have so many happy memories of. I grew up the youngest son of an Air Force officer, living in Buckinghamshire in the 80s, right by the Chalfont hills. A truly beautiful part of the world. You country boys on here would recognise it instantly and be at home there. Kind of town where everyone knew each other and was so high trust. Kids could play in the woods all day and come home at dusk. The only questions our parents would ask is "Where are the boys? Do they have the dog with them? OK that's fine". There was no danger. It was Arcadia.

That world seems gone to me know. I do not recognise my country any more. Our cities are stinking ghettoes, filled with muslim savages. Our government and police ignore any crimes against us, the rightful stewards of this once great land, but rush to protect the interests of the hateful invading horde that squats in our beautiful county.

We welcomed them here. We offered them peace, freedom, and the chance to make whatever they wanted of themselves. They repaid us by raping and murdering our children, blowing us up in suicide attacks, and spewing constant hatred and threats of violence against us.

I never thought it would come to this but I pray for civil war. That is our only hope. I will stay and fight. I am actually relishing the prospect of killing these filthy, ungrateful subhumans. Should I feel shame for that? My innate Englishness tells me I should. But I do not. Any capacity for guilt and shame has been burned away by a white hot fire of hatred I would never have believed I was capable of. A hatred I am scared will consume me.

I am not even sure why I am typing this out. Maybe I just needed to get it off my chest. If you read it, thank you and all I ask is you keep us in your hearts and in your prayers.

Maybe one day, stranger reading this, we will raise a glass together to celebrate the final victory over the evil in the world.

I truly hope so.
